result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian M Gehn

defendant.name: Gehn, Brian M
defendant.address: C/o Iowa County Jail 1205 N. Bequette Street, Dodgeville, WI 53533

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
(15CM470 & 16CM170) Defendant Brian M Gehn in court, in custody with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. here on Writ from Iowa County; State heard on recomm.; victim rights complied with; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads Guilty to Count 1 and Count 2; stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of Retail Theft/Repeater in Counts 1&2 in 15CM470 w/Count 3 D&RI and charges in 16CM170 are D&RI; State heard on recomm; recess taken to discuss offer; Atty. Luchsinger heard; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded

Count 1:
**W/H - 2 years PO
- $300 Rest.
- $243 CC
- $200 DNA surcharge and sample
- AODA & FT
- absolute sobriety, no bars

Count 2
** W/H - 2 years PO conc.
- $266.57 Rest. (from 16CM170)
-  $243 CC
- $200 DNA surcharge and sample
- AODA & FT
- absolute sobriety, no bars
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

15CM470 & 16CM170 - Defendant Brian M Gehn in court, in custody in person with attorney Steven John Luchsinger by phone (15CM470 case only).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Initial held in 16CM170.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
Plea & Sentencing addressed in 15CM470. Parties heard. Court resets for next Monday 6/13 at 3:30 pm; New case set as STC also on that date.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
